item.description: Trying some more traditional digital camera photography for a bit instead of using a smartphone. Kind of miss the ‚Äúold school‚Äù tech. Dug out the Sony NEX-6 from 2012 and used its Wi-Fi (!) to transfer a few test shots to the iPad Pro for light edits. https://t.co/KACPHSBGSX

item.description:
A good, thoughtful thread on @helium as it appears today. And I did drop $450 on a hotspot. Will I make my money back? No idea. But helping to ‚Äúbuild‚Äù a decentralized network for IoT devices was worth it to me. Hopefully, the network will be used by many for its intended purpose. https://t.co/4A801Zea1a

I should also note that the analysis on data usage so far is likely spot on. I‚Äôve had my hotspot for roughly 4 months and it has only seen 3 data packets in all that time. The network is there, but will devices use it is the bigger, more important question in my mind.

And one last data point in regards to data credit usage was $6,500 last month. The data cost is dirt cheap. 1 Helium data credit costs $0.00001. So the pricing model in that regard is completely disruptive for long-range IoT connectivity.
item.source:markdown:
A good, thoughtful thread on @helium as it appears today. And I did drop $450 on a hotspot. Will I make my money back? No idea. But helping to ‚Äúbuild‚Äù a decentralized network for IoT devices was worth it to me. Hopefully, the network will be used by many for its intended purpose. https://t.co/4A801Zea1a
I should also note that the analysis on data usage so far is likely spot on. I‚Äôve had my hotspot for roughly 4 months and it has only seen 3 data packets in all that time. The network is there, but will devices use it is the bigger, more important question in my mind.
And one last data point in regards to data credit usage was $6,500 last month. The data cost is *dirt cheap*. 1 Helium data credit costs $0.00001. So the pricing model in that regard is completely disruptive for long-range IoT connectivity.

item.description: I am LOVING this apt front-end for Linux called Nala. Nice history feature where you can undo and redo actions. Tons of useful features /info and easier on the eyes. More info here: https://t.co/FImjW4Jm2y https://t.co/P0q4wIkUls

item.description: Hate to see @Dell Mobile Connect going away. I don't use my XPS 15 that much, but when I do, I always have it wirelessly connected to my iPhone. Great for reading/replying to messages, photo transfers, etc. https://t.co/d9rPCYvfLY

item.description: @Gartenberg If I‚Äôm going to do that, I might as well fire up the ol‚Äô Dell Axim and whip out the resistive screen stylus. ü§£ Just kidding: I know many people that prefer the tried and true solutions. My hands hurt too much just writing a check every now and then.

item.description: @Gartenberg Was using Roam Research but moved over to Notion; available on all platforms and the web. My JS course notes are there, along with a separate list of coding project ideas and a spot for miscellaneous notes plus saved browser links. I like Keep but need something more ‚Äúpowerful‚Äù.
item.source:markdown: @Gartenberg Was using Roam Research but moved over to Notion; available on all platforms and the web. My JS course notes are there, along with a separate list of coding project ideas and a spot for miscellaneous notes plus saved browser links. I like Keep but need something more ‚Äúpowerful‚Äù.
